results.title: Open house
results.brief_description: A study of some of the famous English country houses which lie near to London and which are open to the public. Sutton Place, Polesden Lacey, Knole, Penshurst Place, West Wycombe Park and Hatfield House are among those shown.

results.title: Junior road safety: only one way
results.creator_credit: Grahame Jennings and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Encourages the correct use of seat belts, and highlights the dangers of playing games on the road and crossing the road between parked cars. Designed for children from 7 to 11 years.

results.title: Printing presses and engineering: one of our own kind
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Baylis, Leslie Sansom and Vickers Films
results.brief_description: Documentary on printing in Yorkshire, Town of Otley, iron casting and printing press made in the 1880s and mass produced in Leeds for distribution overseas. Printing from paper to bottle caps and uptodate methods. Narrated by Anthony Quayle.

results.title: Better ways. 4. One man and his job
results.creator_credit: Peter Morley, Denis Ward and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: Shows application of Work Study methods. The main example is the assembly of governor elements for diesel fuel injection pumps. Reveals how a job is analysed on a two-handed chart. The film digresses to demonstrate the principles of Motion Economy shown under laboratory conditions at the Work Study School of the College of Aeronautics. The film shows how special fixtures and bench designs were fashioned, and the worker trained in the new methods. Stresses that the human factor must always be understood in Work Study.
results.title_for_label: Better ways. 4. One man and his job
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Morley, Denis Ward and British Productivity Council

results.title: One for the road
results.creator_credit: Dennis A. Hill and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A few hours in the life of Bill Smith show why you should not mix drinking with driving. The affect of alcohol is illustrated with a model brain: although not drunk Smith’s brain power was sufficiently impaired to cause a fatal accident.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis A. Hill and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: On time
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Department of the Interior and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: More than 100,000 train passengers pass through the gates at Flinders Street Station, Melbourne each day. Control of passenger and freight trains in and out of the station on time is a masterpiece of precision planning.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson, Department of the Interior and Victorian Railways

results.title: On three moon creek: Australian paintings by Gil Jamieson
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Patrick Ryan and Eltham Films
results.brief_description: Gil Jamieson’s paintings of outback Queensland life, depicting drought, fire, flood, harvest, and a rodeo. The film is animated by camera movement and accompanied by a ballad written by Tim Burstall and performed by Donald Ayrton and John Earle.

results.title: On the Bowery
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary tells about life in New York’s Bowery, the haunt of alcoholics and derelicts. No attempt is made to sensationalise; it is simply an objective, but at the same time stark and moving, account of men who have passed the point of no return and live in a half-world of cheap drink, argument, theft, card-playing and bread and soup from the local mission.
